qas.question: During what time period was the Devonian era?
Which continent was formed from the meeting of Laurentia and Baltica?
Which sedimentary beds were created in the dry areas of Euramerica in the Devonian period?
Which mountains associated with the USA were formed near the equator on  Pangaea during the Devonian?
What was the largest ocean referred to that existed in the Devonian period?
What kind of activity decreased during the Devonian?
What two continents where moving away from each other during Devonian?
What continent was formed when Laurasia and Gondwanna colided?
What type od seimentary beds formed in the desert along the Tropic of Capricorn?
What was shallow arounfd the world?

context: The Devonian spanned roughly from <a0_0>419 to 359 Ma.<a0_0/> The period was a time of great <b5_0>tectonic activity<b5_0/>, as <b6_0>Laurasia and Gondwana<b6_0/> drew closer together. The continent <a1_0><b7_0>Euramerica<b7_0/> (or Laurussia)<a1_0/> was created in the early Devonian by the collision of Laurentia and Baltica, which rotated into the natural dry zone along the Tropic of Capricorn. In these near-deserts, the <a2_0><b8_0>Old Red Sandstone<b8_0/><a2_0/> sedimentary beds formed, made red by the oxidized iron (hematite) characteristic of drought conditions. Near the equator Pangaea began to consolidate from the plates containing North America and Europe, further raising <a3_0>the northern Appalachian Mountains<a3_0/> and forming the Caledonian Mountains in Great Britain and Scandinavia. The southern continents remained tied together in the supercontinent of Gondwana. The remainder of modern Eurasia lay in the Northern Hemisphere. Sea levels were high worldwide, and much of the land lay submerged under shallow <b9_0>seas<b9_0/>. The deep, enormous <a4_0>Panthalassa<a4_0/> (the "universal ocean") covered the rest of the planet. Other minor oceans were Paleo-Tethys, Proto-Tethys, Rheic Ocean and Ural Ocean (which was closed during the collision with Siberia and Baltica).
